section.title: Description of the default algorithms
section.para:
This chapter will describe the default algorithms you can chose for the
ModelCreator

section.title: AssociationAlgorithmInPackages
section.para:
This algorithm does only create associations along the package trees and not between. In
you can see how the associations look like.
Linking of the model

To do this the algorithm first saves the package to each class and interface. During the creation of the associations the association ending can only be a class that match one of following conditions:
- the end class is in the same package as the begin classifier
- the end class is in a superpackage of the begin classifier
- the end class is in a subpackage of the begin classifier's package

listitem.para: The algorithm produces only binary and also no undirected associations.
All parameters are calculated, but unfortunately this depends on HashCode so the algorithm can not be assured to be 100 % deterministic.
The algorithm is used for associations and association classes.
Associations between interfaces and classes are only navigable from the class and can not be association classes.
There are no associations from an interface to another interface
Associations to itself are also possible
To write your own algorithm you can implement the AssociationAlgorithm interface

section.title: GeneralizationAlgorithmImpl
section.para:
This algorithm is needed to create generalizations for classifiers. First some classifiers will be chosen by an offset, which is calculated with the given parameters. After that generalizations will be created from to lowest level to the highest in one tree and after that the next tree will be created. In
you see how the generalization work.

listitem.para: The algorithm works for interfaces and classes, but only from interfaces to interfaces and classes to classes.
Before creating generalizations it will be checked if enough classifiers are available. If not, every classifier is in the list for generalizations.
Before creating a tree, the complete lowest level will first be chosen.

The amount of classes/interfaces needed for the generalizations is the
Amount of Generalizations
plus one.
The algorithm does not create multiple inheritance.
The algorithm has nothing to do with interface realizations.
To write your own algorithm you can implement the GeneralizationAlgorithm interface
